alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 4:56AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Saturated soils could allow trees to fall with very little winds, which are expected to develop later this morning. Extra caution should be taken during the morning commutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Jackman, Eustis, Coburn Gore, Madison, Jay, Kingfield, Bingham, Carrabassett Valley and Phillips.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains.
